intro: Adinandra formosana var. hypochlora, commonly known as the pale-leaved adinandra, is a rare evergreen shrub native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are lighter in color compared to the typical variety. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, spherical fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
